intro: Pimpinella saxifraga f. cuneato-ovata, commonly known as the cuneato-ovate cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender stems and small, compound leaves with a distinctive cuneate or ovate shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, and it blooms in early spring. This variety is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
